docs.abstract: The $7 trillion investment giant says it will make environmental concerns a key investment focus, and Wall Street may have no choice but to follow suit.
docs.snippet: The $7 trillion investment giant says it will make environmental concerns a key investment focus, and Wall Street may have no choice but to follow suit.
docs.lead_paragraph: Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.)

headline.main: BlackRock Puts Climate Change Center Stage

docs.abstract: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
docs.snippet: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

docs.abstract: The former Fox News anchor has mostly ignored the movie in which she is played by Charlize Theron — until now.
docs.snippet: The former Fox News anchor has mostly ignored the movie in which she is played by Charlize Theron — until now.
docs.lead_paragraph: Megyn Kelly has kept her distance from “Bombshell,” a Hollywood awards contender that presents her as a key figure in exposing sexual harassment at Fox News. Until now.

headline.main: Megyn Kelly Talks About Roger Ailes and ‘Bombshell’ in YouTube Video
headline.print_headline: In an Online Video, Kelly Goes Public About Ailes, Harassment, Fox News and ‘Bombshell’

docs.abstract: To defend against shareholder lawsuits over its handling of sexual harassment, Alphabet, the parent of Google, has hired a law firm and is investigating allegations involving executives.
docs.snippet: To defend against shareholder lawsuits over its handling of sexual harassment, Alphabet, the parent of Google, has hired a law firm and is investigating allegations involving executives.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Alphabet’s board of directors is investigating allegations of sexual misconduct and inappropriate relationships by current and former executives as part of its legal defense against shareholder lawsuits over its handling of the matters, according to documents viewed by The New York Times.

headline.main: Alphabet Board Investigates Sexual Misconduct Accusations
headline.print_headline: Google’s Parent Company Investigates Sexual Misconduct Accusations

docs.abstract: The self-governing island is on high alert for digital-age trickery and deception that Beijing might be using to try to swing a crucial election.
docs.snippet: The self-governing island is on high alert for digital-age trickery and deception that Beijing might be using to try to swing a crucial election.
docs.lead_paragraph: TAIPEI, Taiwan — At first glance, the bespectacled YouTuber railing against Taiwan’s president, Tsai Ing-wen, just seems like a concerned citizen making an appeal to his fellow Taiwanese.

headline.main: Awash in Disinformation Before Vote, Taiwan Points Finger at China

docs.abstract: The Labor Department’s monthly jobs report suggests that the economy ended 2019 on a steady footing.
docs.snippet: The Labor Department’s monthly jobs report suggests that the economy ended 2019 on a steady footing.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American labor market completed a decade-long marathon of hiring in the final month of 2019, and still shows few signs that it is running out of breath.

headline.main: After a Decade of Hiring, Plenty of Jobs but Raises Are Tiny
headline.print_headline: Find a Job? Not So Hard. Get a Raise? Good Luck.

docs.abstract: By opting not to change the company’s political advertising rules, Mark Zuckerberg has ensured another election shaped by the social network.
docs.snippet: By opting not to change the company’s political advertising rules, Mark Zuckerberg has ensured another election shaped by the social network.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — If you were hoping to hear less about Facebook this year, you’re out of luck.

headline.main: Buckle Up for Another Facebook Election

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: Samira Ahmed sued the British public broadcaster for back pay after she learned that a male colleague doing similar work was paid more than six times as much.
docs.snippet: Samira Ahmed sued the British public broadcaster for back pay after she learned that a male colleague doing similar work was paid more than six times as much.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The television host who took the BBC to court over unequal pay has won the first high-profile court case to be brought since the fallout over pay disparity at the public broadcaster began more than two years ago.

headline.main: BBC Underpaid Female TV Host, Tribunal Rules
headline.print_headline: BBC Underpaid Female TV Host, Tribunal Rules in Equal Pay Case

docs.abstract: The university investigated its history with Mr. Epstein after Joichi Ito, the face of its prominent Media Lab program, acknowledged receiving money from the convicted sex offender.
docs.snippet: The university investigated its history with Mr. Epstein after Joichi Ito, the face of its prominent Media Lab program, acknowledged receiving money from the convicted sex offender.
docs.lead_paragraph: Over 15 years, the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein repeatedly donated to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Top administrators knew about the gifts, felt conflicted about them, and accepted them anyway. The university’s president even signed a thank-you note.

headline.main: Jeffrey Epstein Gave $850,000 to M.I.T., and Administrators Knew
headline.print_headline: M.I.T. Took $850,000 From Epstein Under ‘Informal Framework’

byline.original: By Tiffany Hsu, David Yaffe-Bellany and Marc Tracy

docs.abstract: The Silicon Valley giant is preparing for a legal fight over encryption, even as it works to reduce tensions with the Justice Department.
docs.snippet: The Silicon Valley giant is preparing for a legal fight over encryption, even as it works to reduce tensions with the Justice Department.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple is privately preparing for a legal fight with the Justice Department to defend encryption on its iPhones while publicly trying to defuse the dispute, as the technology giant navigates an increasingly tricky line between its customers and the Trump administration.

headline.main: Apple Takes a (Cautious) Stand Against Opening a Killer’s iPhones
headline.print_headline: U.S. Request for Access to Gunman’s Phone Data Puts Apple in Bind

byline.original: By Jack Nicas and Katie Benner
